Sample_Name.description: Sample name used for lab analysis - unique to each sample

Sample_Plate.description: identifier for Sample Plate (96-samples per plate) the sample was prepared on prior to EPIC analysis (i.e. bisulfite conversion)

barcode.description: barcode that labels the data on the EPIC array; can be used to link to full EPIC array

EPIC_Round.description: EPIC analyses were completed at different times for different sets of samples.

foliocc.description: Original ELEMENT study ID, unique to an individual child

Array.description: identifier for position on EPIC chip the sample was placed on

Slide.description: identifier for EPIC chip the sample was run on

ArrayTypes.description: What type of Infinium Array was used that the data came from?

PC1.description: PC1 of the batch PCs - made using SVA from control probes on each array (Teschendorff et al. 2011). These are the PCs that explain >90% of the variability of the data from the control probes on each array. They should be adjusted for to control for batch

PC2.description: PC2 of the batch PCs - made using SVA from control probes on each array (Teschendorff et al. 2011). These are the PCs that explain >90% of the variability of the data from the control probes on each array. They should be adjusted for to control for batch

PC3.description: PC3 of the batch PCs - made using SVA from control probes on each array (Teschendorff et al. 2011). These are the PCs that explain >90% of the variability of the data from the control probes on each array. They should be adjusted for to control for batch

PC4.description: PC4 of the batch PCs - made using SVA from control probes on each array (Teschendorff et al. 2011). These are the PCs that explain >90% of the variability of the data from the control probes on each array. They should be adjusted for to control for batch

PC5.description: PC5 of the batch PCs - made using SVA from control probes on each array (Teschendorff et al. 2011). These are the PCs that explain >90% of the variability of the data from the control probes on each array. They should be adjusted for to control for batch

AgeAccelerationDiff.description: Difference between Horvath clock and chronological age

AgeAccelerationResidual.description: Horvath epigenetic clock, residuals after regressing on chronological age

CD8T.description: estimated proportion of CD8+ T-cells in the blood sample sample that DNA was isolated from, estimated via the Houseman et al. 2012 method

CD4T.description: estimated proportion of CD4+ T-cells in the blood sample sample that DNA was isolated from, estimated via the Houseman et al. 2012 method

NK.description: estimated proportion of natural killer cells in the blood sample sample that DNA was isolated from, estimated via the Houseman et al. 2012 method

Bcell.description: estimated proportion of B cells in the blood sample sample that DNA was isolated from, estimated via the Houseman et al. 2012 method

Mono.description: estimated proportion of monocytes in the blood sample sample that DNA was isolated from, estimated via the Houseman et al. 2012 method

PlasmaBlast.description: estimated relative abundance of Plasmablasts (from Horvath clock algorithm database)

CD8pCD28nCD45RAn.description: estimated relative abundance of CD8pCD28nCD45RAn cells (from Horvath clock algorithm database)

CD8.naive.description: estimated relative abundance of naïve CD8+ T cells (from Horvath clock algorithm database)

CD4.naive.description: estimated relative abundance of naïve CD4+ T cells (from Horvath clock algorithm database)

DNAmTL.description: Estimated telomere length from DNA methylation data

DNAmAgeSkinBloodClockAdjAge.description: Skin and Blood epigenetic clock, residuals after regressing on chronological age

DNAmTLAdjAge.description: estimated telomere length, residuals after regressing on chronological age

AgeAccelerationResidualHannum.description: Hannum epigenetic clock, residuals after regressing on chronological age

AgeAccelGrim.description: GrimAge epigenetic clock, residuals after regressing on chronological age

AgeAccelPheno.description: PhenoAge (Levine's) epigenetic clock, residuals after regressing on chronological age
